newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Bangladesh taka ends firmer in dull market.
newsitem.headline: Bangladesh taka ends firmer in dull market.

text.p: A lack of importers in the interbank market helped the Bangladesh taka retain early gains and close firmer at 42.8375/8425 to the dollar on Saturday compared with the previous close at 42.8430/8490, dealers said.
The local unit had opened stronger at 42.8300/8450 per dollar with dollar demand remaining poor due to the weekend closure of international markets.
"Major players were absent. Few private banks bought a small amount (of dollars)," said one dealer. Friday is the weekend in Moslem Bangladesh.
The interbank call money rates finished at 5.5 to 6.5 percent against Thursday's close at 6.25-6.75 percent.
